result.execSummary:
The defendant Vequan T McDade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for THREE (3) DAYS time served.  GOOD TIME TO APPLY.  STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON PROBATION or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: * Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vequan T McDade

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vequan T McDade in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for THREE (3) DAYS time served.  GOOD TIME TO APPLY.  STRAIGHT TIME.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

OTHER/CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON PROBATION or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Filed,

Defendant Vequan T McDade in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vequan T McDade in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas for Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

WARRANT NOT SUBMITTED TO MCSO.  CLERK DESTROYED WARRANT.  Review hearing scheduled for February 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin for Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Vequan T McDade in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Fokus believes Defendant may need a higher level of treatment. Defense requested that the motion to revoke be taken under advisement to permit the Defendant a chance to obtain further treatment.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Review hearing scheduled for February 5, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Vequan T McDade in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant Vequan T McDade in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  
Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Ashley, Branch 33 for review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vequan T McDade in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#16-011
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.
